SEARCH
Package network.rpc.server

Class Client

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
network.rpc.server.Client
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, ClientInterface
public class Client extends Thread implements ClientInterface
Class to represent a client connected to the server via socket.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()

    • isDisconnected

      public boolean isDisconnected()
      Method that checks if the client is in a disconnected state by comparing the current status of the client with the ClientStatus.Disconnected value. It returns a boolean indicating whether the client is disconnected or not.
      Specified by:
      isDisconnected in interface ClientInterface
      Returns:
      A boolean indicating whether the client is disconnected or not.

    • checkPing

      public boolean checkPing()
      Method that checks the ping status of the client. If the client is already disconnected, it returns false. Otherwise, it synchronizes on the lastMessageTimeLock to ensure thread safety. It compares the last message time with the current time plus a timeout period. If the last message time is earlier than the current time plus the timeout, it disconnects the client and returns false. Otherwise, it returns true indicating that the ping is successful.
      Specified by:
      checkPing in interface ClientInterface
      Returns:
      true if the client is still connected, false otherwise

    • run

      public void run()
      Method that represents the main execution loop of the client. It continuously runs while the client's status is not set to ClientStatus.Disconnected. The receive method is called to receive a Call object from the server. The lastMessageTime is updated to the current time, synchronized on the lastMessageTimeLock for thread safety. If the received call's service is Service.Ping, a response with a Result indicating a successful ping is sent back. Otherwise, the received call is passed to the handler function along with the client instance to process it. The resulting Result object is sent back to the server. If a DisconnectedClientException is caught during the execution, a warning message is logged.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread

    • getCallHandler

      public BiFunction<Call<Serializable>,ClientInterface,Result<Serializable>> getCallHandler()
      Method that retrieves the call handler function responsible for handling incoming calls from the server. The call handler function is a BiFunction that takes a Call object and a ClientInterface as input and returns a Result object. The call handler function is synchronized on the handlerLock object to ensure thread safety.
      Specified by:
      getCallHandler in interface ClientInterface
      Returns:
      handler

    • recoverStatus

      public void recoverStatus()
      Get the status of the client.
